alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 2:36PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM ARIZONA TIME /5 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR KEAMS CANYON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas near Keams Canyon across northeast Arizona. This includes portions of Apache and Navajo counties. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST /500 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding and rapid rises on creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM Arizona Time /332 PM Navajo Nation Time/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Keams Canyon Wash, Jeddito Wash, Beshbito Wash, Polacca Wash, Wepo Wash, Ha-whi-yalin Wash, Steamboat Wash and Bluebird Canyon Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keams Canyon, Jeddito, Jadito, Toyei, Steamboat Canyon, Steamboat, Village of Walpi, Polacca Airport, Sipaulovi, Toreva, Navajo, Navajo Reservation and Hopi Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 384 and 389...and near mile marker 398...and between mile markers 401 and 439. State Route 87 between mile markers 395 and 406. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
